basics.name: Nathan Schucher
basics.label: Research Engineer
basics.summary: I am a Research Engineer at Google Deepmind. I work on Gemini post-training and evaluation infrastructure.

work.name: Google Deepmind
highlights: Gemini 1.5 core: long-context data and evaluations
Gemini evaluation infrastructure for pre and post-training

work.name: ServiceNow Research
highlights: Parameter-efficient fine-tuning for code generation and low-resource semantic parsing

work.name: Element AI
highlights: Implemented fast mixed-precision multinode training with infiniband for fast training of large language models
Lead development of distributed hyperparameter search system used by dozens of researchers for large-scale experimentation
Built a visualization and experiment management platform for analyzing of thousands of model training runs
Analysis of multimodal clustering in affine transformation parameters for VQA models

work.name: Recurse Center
highlights: Attended a 12-week coding retreat focused on self-directed, project-based learning
Reproduced state-of-the-art deep recurrent machine reading model in TensorFlow
Implemented a tape-based autodiff computation library in JavaScript

publications.name: Gemini 1.5: Unlocking multimodal understanding across millions of tokens of context
Gemini: A Family of Highly Capable Multimodal Models
The Power of Prompt Tuning for Low-Resource Semantic Parsing
publications.authors: Nathan Schucher, Siva Reddy, Harm de Vries

publications.name: PICARD: Parsing Incrementally for Constrained Auto-Regressive Decoding from Language Models
publications.authors: Torsten Scholak, Nathan Schucher, Dzmitry Bahdanau

publications.name: Feature-wise transformations
publications.authors: Vincent Dumoulin, Ethan Perez, Nathan Schucher, Florian Strub, Harm de Vries, Aaron Courville, Yoshua Bengio
